title: Wall Street Bonuses Are Poised to Rebound: Banking Industry Monitor
description: Traders are likely to fare well. Also back in favor: Fannie, Freddie and JPMorgan bank branches
content:
Welcome to Bloomberg's Banking Industry Monitor. Every Thursday we'll deliver you the top news of the global banking industry with emerging trends, winners and losers and market opportunities. Sign up now if you're not already on the list.



It’s never too early to talk about bonus season, especially if payouts are going to be bigger this year — which they are, thanks to a volatile market. Equity traders are likely to be especially blessed, perhaps with 30% increases, but the same can’t be said if your remit is retail and commercial banking. And if you’re at Macquarie, bear in mind that its executive pay plan is under fire.



In less uplifting news, financial pros are trying to understand what happened at Jane Street, after India’s authorities accused the firm of messing with prices. Jane Street has said it did nothing wrong. UBS meanwhile is paying the price for something it didn’t do — about $300 million for missteps inherited from Credit Suisse.



Donald Trump figured in more than a few banking developments this week, with tariffs putting a damper on US bank results in Europe. The president meanwhile was chatting with Big 6 bankers about a potential public offering for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac — even while asserting that two, including JPMorgan Chase, had refused to do business with him in the past. It wouldn’t be for lack of branches; Chase opened 1,000 new offices in the past seven years, for a total of nearly 5,000. — Rick Green

The following was produced with the assistance of Bloomberg Automation.
summary: Bloomberg's Banking Industry Monitor provides the top news of the global banking industry, highlighting potential increases in bonuses due to volatile market conditions. Equity traders are likely to see a significant increase in their payouts, perhaps by 30%, while retail and commercial banking companies may also see a decrease. Meanwhile, UBS is paying $300 million for missteps inherited from Credit Suisse. In other news, JPMorgan Chase has opened 1,000 new offices in the past seven years, bringing its total to nearly 5,000. Donald Trump has also been involved in several banking developments, including discussions with Big 6 bankers about a potential public offering for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.
shortSummary: Banks' annual bonus season is underway, with potential increases expected amid volatile markets, while UBS and Macquarie face criticism and challenges from regulatory investigations.

Additionally, Donald Trump discussed potential public offerings for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac with major bankers, amidst challenges posed by tariffs affecting US bank results in Europe.
